topics.body: And now for your daily science news: apparently a universal test for cancer is in the works.  I'm just going to summarize quickly cause I'm really freaking tired and don't feel like going into a long explanation; essentially cancerous cells' dna is more easily damaged by uv light than non-cancerous.  What this means is that in the future they could take some of your blood, put it in a machine to tell if the dna is easily damaged by UV light if it is you have cancer or will soon have cancer; if it's not then you don't have cancer.

topics.body:
Good! My family from Kaohsiung, Taiwan is okay. A little shaken by the gas explosion, but alright.

Death toll climbed to 28, with over 200 injured. And Estimated $500,000 worth of infrastructure damage. 

The explosion was strong enough to throw car onto the roof of highrises! They are investigating the cause of the explosion.
